Articles.Content: Did anyone else try decoding the sound backwards?

Did anyone else try decoding the sound backwards?

Holy crap, this guy may (or may not) be onto something. After all, the Kermans in the teaser were speaking reverse-Mexican.

I don't think that will work, there is a start signal for the decoder to know the beginning of the picture, but I will give it a shot. I did low pass and high pass filters and it cleaned up this image a little, but just barely.

oops, forgot to post the pic... Anyways, I would LOVE for someone else to do this too as, I am not sure if this is right. Now, there is a 4 in the bottom corner (it being completely inverted in the original was what made me want to try this backward) with a matching colored dot, there are now three orange things, and this looks to be on some planet that has a purple atmosphere. My guess it that there is a pattern on Eve that has either 3 craters in a row, or the 4 and dot crater, near that you have to EVA (thus the shadowy Kerbalnaut). This is all speculation tho.
nah, playing it backwards just garbles the info, looking up SSTV signal kinda explains why. You won't get anything useful out of reversing the signal, just garbled bits of the original.
okay, but hear me out. I did get a picture that has things that the original did not, IE, the shadowy dude in the upper right

I think you're just corrupting the existing SSTV image. I don't think that's the answer.

Has anyone calculated/visited the L1 lagrange point between Ike and Duna yet? I suspect that the 6 dots could be measurements, telling us that the magic boulder is located 6/7ths of the way to Ike, at the lagrange point.
In the end, I think it is going to be something like a map for the escape trajectory needed to get to another solar system, or just saying "when these planets line up, they point at another system"

That is Minmus whilst viewed in IVA and zoomed in.

Trust me, the magic boulder ain't lookin' like that yo

Oh god...

Its going to CREEPY!!!

Edited September 25, 2012 by mrrpamplemousse
It's a map, I know it. The symbol above may mean Kerbin and the KSP, and the 4 persons below are you finding the hill. And the hill, has a map nearby it.

Do you think perhaps the angular figure appears to represent two angles consistent with the kind of angles which specify interplanetary transfers of the kind given by Olex's "Interactive illustrated interplanetary guide and calculator for KSP 0.17"? http://ksp.olex.biz/

Assuming my "boulder at lagrange point" theory is right...

A quick napkin calculation r = R * cuberoot(M2 / (3 * M1), indicates that the lagrange point should be approximately 27% of the way from Ike to Duna: 875,813 m above Ike or 2,324,186 m above Duna.

That is roughly at the 5th yellow marker (or the second, if you're counting downwards) to the right of the red line (~ 28.5%). Within error tolerances, certainly. Coincidence? I'll let you decide.

i like it........

are you finding the hill

That's an awefully specific transmission for a potential alien species to be sending from probably before they knew Kerbals would ever be capable of space travel.

What is "MK 1 cockpit"?

that was taken out....
The command pod you used on the ship you built to look at the debug log.

oh, ok

Im trying to make out a pattern with the orbit staring of the planets and moons...... to find where the boulder spawns at

jool last, mun first......

hmmmmmmmm

http://soundcloud.com/dphaklides/sagananomaly

Maybe it's related to the Duna one?
Can anyone decode the signal?

It's a face. Looks to be a screenshot from one of the planets.

Here:
It's a screenshot of the Tylo Sagan, already documented elsehere in this thread. In other words, not a part of the puzzle. :/

What about the strange half-image from the second part of the original SSTV signal?

Maybe it's related to the Duna one?

I believe he took the picture, then encoded it.

What about the strange half-image from the second part of the original SSTV signal?

(denoised):

Something reminds me of Tiki heads...

I believed that that was the same image as all the other ones, except extremely corrupted. Everything you see in there is from the other image.

What about the strange half-image from the second part of the original SSTV signal?

(denoised):

Something reminds me of Tiki heads...

I managed to decode the second part, it is actually just a repeat of the first. I also when to the location of the noise and let it decode the repeating sound for 20 minutes, it is all the same picture, just repeating. Something of interest though! I saw the arrow at the bottom of the image pointed to the south pole, so I landed there, and there was a pyramid like mound! and a line of ridges leading away from the pole starting with this pyramid like structure...

Edited September 26, 2012 by NolanSyKinsley

Ah, I see.

Mind posting screenshots?
